alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Hendricks; Johnson; Marion; Monroe; Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:14AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Monroe, eastern Morgan, Johnson, Brown, northwestern Bartholomew, southeastern Hendricks and southern Marion Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 213 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Plainfield to near Martinsville to near Bloomington. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beech Grove, Southport, Greenwood, Nashville and Franklin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 75 and 76, and between mile markers 84 and 106. Interstate 70 between mile markers 63 and 73. Interstate 74 between mile markers 98 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bartholomew; Brown; Hendricks; Johnson; Marion; Monroe; Morgan
